content: 1 In the days when the chieftains ruled, there was a famine in the land; and a man of Bethlehem in Judah, with his wife and two sons, went to reside in the country of Moab.
content_old: 1 In the days when the chieftains ruled, there was a famine in the land; and a man of Bethlehem in Judah, with his wife and two sons, went to reside in the country of Moab.

content: 2 The man’s name was Elimelech, his wife’s name was Naomi, and his two sons were named Mahlon and Chilion—Ephrathites of Bethlehem in Judah. They came to the country of Moab and remained there.
content_old: 2 The man’s name was Elimelech, his wife’s name was Naomi, and his two sons were named Mahlon and Chilion—Ephrathites of Bethlehem in Judah. They came to the country of Moab and remained there.

content: 3 Elimelech, Naomi’s husband, died; and she was left with her two sons.
content_old: 3 Elimelech, Naomi’s husband, died; and she was left with her two sons.

content: 4 They married Moabite women, one named Orpah and the other Ruth, and they lived there about ten years.
content_old: 4 They married Moabite women, one named Orpah and the other Ruth, and they lived there about ten years.

content: 5 Then those two—Mahlon and Chilion—also died; so the woman was left without her two sons and without her husband.
content_old: 5 Then those two—Mahlon and Chilion—also died; so the woman was left without her two sons and without her husband.

content: 6 She started out with her daughters-in-law to return from the country of Moab; for in the country of Moab she had heard that the LORD had taken note of His people and given them food.
content_old: 6 She started out with her daughters-in-law to return from the country of Moab; for in the country of Moab she had heard that the LORD had taken note of His people and given them food.

content: 7 Accompanied by her two daughters-in-law, she left the place where she had been living; and they set out on the road back to the land of Judah.
content_old: 7 Accompanied by her two daughters-in-law, she left the place where she had been living; and they set out on the road back to the land of Judah.

content: 8 But Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, “Turn back, each of you to her mother’s house. May the LORD deal kindly with you, as you have dealt with the dead and with me!
content_old: 8 But Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, “Turn back, each of you to her mother’s house. May the LORD deal kindly with you, as you have dealt with the dead and with me!

content: 9 May the LORD grant that each of you find security in the house of a husband!” And she kissed them farewell. They broke into weeping
content_old: 9 May the LORD grant that each of you find security in the house of a husband!” And she kissed them farewell. They broke into weeping

content: 10 and said to her, “No, we will return with you to your people.”
content_old: 10 and said to her, “No, we will return with you to your people.”

content: 11 But Naomi replied, “Turn back, my daughters! Why should you go with me? Have I any more sons in my body who might be husbands for you?
content_old: 11 But Naomi replied, “Turn back, my daughters! Why should you go with me? Have I any more sons in my body who might be husbands for you?

content: 12 Turn back, my daughters, for I am too old to be married. Even if I thought there was hope for me, even if I were married tonight and I also bore sons,
content_old: 12 Turn back, my daughters, for I am too old to be married. Even if I thought there was hope for me, even if I were married tonight and I also bore sons,

content: 13 should you wait for them to grow up? Should you on their account debar yourselves from marriage? Oh no, my daughters! My lot is far more bitter than yours, for the hand of the LORD has struck out against me.”
content_old: 13 should you wait for them to grow up? Should you on their account debar yourselves from marriage? Oh no, my daughters! My lot is far more bitter than yours, for the hand of the LORD has struck out against me.”

content: 14 They broke into weeping again, and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law farewell. But Ruth clung to her.
content_old: 14 They broke into weeping again, and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law farewell. But Ruth clung to her.

content: 15 So she said, “See, your sister-in-law has returned to her people and her gods. Go follow your sister-in-law.”
content_old: 15 So she said, “See, your sister-in-law has returned to her people and her gods. Go follow your sister-in-law.”

content: 16 But Ruth replied, “Do not urge me to leave you, to turn back and not follow you. For wherever you go, I will go; wherever you lodge, I will lodge; your people shall be my people, and your God my God.
content_old: 16 But Ruth replied, “Do not urge me to leave you, to turn back and not follow you. For wherever you go, I will go; wherever you lodge, I will lodge; your people shall be my people, and your God my God.

content: 17 Where you die, I will die, and there I will be buried. Thus and more may the LORD do to me if anything but death parts me from you.”
content_old: 17 Where you die, I will die, and there I will be buried. Thus and more may the LORD do to me if anything but death parts me from you.”

content: 18 When Naomi saw how determined she was to go with her, she ceased to argue with her;
content_old: 18 When Naomi saw how determined she was to go with her, she ceased to argue with her;

content: 19 and the two went on until they reached Bethlehem. When they arrived in Bethlehem, the whole city buzzed with excitement over them. The women said, “Can this be Naomi?”
content_old: 19 and the two went on until they reached Bethlehem. When they arrived in Bethlehem, the whole city buzzed with excitement over them. The women said, “Can this be Naomi?”

content: 20 “Do not call me Naomi,” she replied. “Call me Mara, for Shaddai has made my lot very bitter.
content_old: 20 “Do not call me Naomi,” she replied. “Call me Mara, for Shaddai has made my lot very bitter.

content: 21 I went away full, and the LORD has brought me back empty. How can you call me Naomi, when the LORD has dealt harshly with me, when Shaddai has brought misfortune upon me!”
content_old: 21 I went away full, and the LORD has brought me back empty. How can you call me Naomi, when the LORD has dealt harshly with me, when Shaddai has brought misfortune upon me!”

content: 1 Now Naomi had a kinsman on her husband’s side, a man of substance, of the family of Elimelech, whose name was Boaz.
content_old: 1 Now Naomi had a kinsman on her husband’s side, a man of substance, of the family of Elimelech, whose name was Boaz.

content: 2 Ruth the Moabite said to Naomi, “I would like to go to the fields and glean among the ears of grain, behind someone who may show me kindness.” “Yes, daughter, go,” she replied;
content_old: 2 Ruth the Moabite said to Naomi, “I would like to go to the fields and glean among the ears of grain, behind someone who may show me kindness.” “Yes, daughter, go,” she replied;

content: 3 and off she went. She came and gleaned in a field, behind the reapers; and, as luck would have it, it was the piece of land belonging to Boaz, who was of Elimelech’s family.
content_old: 3 and off she went. She came and gleaned in a field, behind the reapers; and, as luck would have it, it was the piece of land belonging to Boaz, who was of Elimelech’s family.

content: 4 Presently Boaz arrived from Bethlehem. He greeted the reapers, “The LORD be with you!” And they responded, “The LORD bless you!”
content_old: 4 Presently Boaz arrived from Bethlehem. He greeted the reapers, “The LORD be with you!” And they responded, “The LORD bless you!”

content: 5 Boaz said to the servant who was in charge of the reapers, “Whose girl is that?”
content_old: 5 Boaz said to the servant who was in charge of the reapers, “Whose girl is that?”

content: 6 The servant in charge of the reapers replied, “She is a Moabite girl who came back with Naomi from the country of Moab.
content_old: 6 The servant in charge of the reapers replied, “She is a Moabite girl who came back with Naomi from the country of Moab.

content: 7 She said, ‘Please let me glean and gather among the sheaves behind the reapers.’ She has been on her feet ever since she came this morning. She has rested but little in the hut.”
content_old: 7 She said, ‘Please let me glean and gather among the sheaves behind the reapers.’ She has been on her feet ever since she came this morning. She has rested but little in the hut.”

content: 8 Boaz said to Ruth, “Listen to me, daughter. Don’t go to glean in another field. Don’t go elsewhere, but stay here close to my girls.
content_old: 8 Boaz said to Ruth, “Listen to me, daughter. Don’t go to glean in another field. Don’t go elsewhere, but stay here close to my girls.

content: 9 Keep your eyes on the field they are reaping, and follow them. I have ordered the men not to molest you. And when you are thirsty, go to the jars and drink some of the water that the men have drawn.”
content_old: 9 Keep your eyes on the field they are reaping, and follow them. I have ordered the men not to molest you. And when you are thirsty, go to the jars and drink some of the water that the men have drawn.”

content: 10 She prostrated herself with her face to the ground, and said to him, “Why are you so kind as to single me out, when I am a foreigner?”
content_old: 10 She prostrated herself with her face to the ground, and said to him, “Why are you so kind as to single me out, when I am a foreigner?”

content: 11 Boaz said in reply, “I have been told of all that you did for your mother-in-law after the death of your husband, how you left your father and mother and the land of your birth and came to a people you had not known before.
content_old: 11 Boaz said in reply, “I have been told of all that you did for your mother-in-law after the death of your husband, how you left your father and mother and the land of your birth and came to a people you had not known before.

content: 12 May the LORD reward your deeds. May you have a full recompense from the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have sought refuge!”
content_old: 12 May the LORD reward your deeds. May you have a full recompense from the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have sought refuge!”

content: 13 She answered, “You are most kind, my lord, to comfort me and to speak gently to your maidservant—though I am not so much as one of your maidservants.”
content_old: 13 She answered, “You are most kind, my lord, to comfort me and to speak gently to your maidservant—though I am not so much as one of your maidservants.”

content: 14 At mealtime, Boaz said to her, “Come over here and partake of the meal, and dip your morsel in the vinegar.” So she sat down beside the reapers. He handed her roasted grain, and she ate her fill and had some left over.
content_old: 14 At mealtime, Boaz said to her, “Come over here and partake of the meal, and dip your morsel in the vinegar.” So she sat down beside the reapers. He handed her roasted grain, and she ate her fill and had some left over.

content: 15 When she got up again to glean, Boaz gave orders to his workers, “You are not only to let her glean among the sheaves, without interference,
content_old: 15 When she got up again to glean, Boaz gave orders to his workers, “You are not only to let her glean among the sheaves, without interference,

content: 16 but you must also pull some out of the heaps and leave them for her to glean, and not scold her.”
content_old: 16 but you must also pull some out of the heaps and leave them for her to glean, and not scold her.”

content: 17 She gleaned in the field until evening. Then she beat out what she had gleaned—it was about an ephah of barley—
content_old: 17 She gleaned in the field until evening. Then she beat out what she had gleaned—it was about an ephah of barley—

content: 18 and carried it back with her to the town. When her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned, and when she also took out and gave her what she had left over after eating her fill,
content_old: 18 and carried it back with her to the town. When her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned, and when she also took out and gave her what she had left over after eating her fill,

content: 19 her mother-in-law asked her, “Where did you glean today? Where did you work? Blessed be he who took such generous notice of you!” So she told her mother-in-law whom she had worked with, saying, “The name of the man with whom I worked today is Boaz.”
content_old: 19 her mother-in-law asked her, “Where did you glean today? Where did you work? Blessed be he who took such generous notice of you!” So she told her mother-in-law whom she had worked with, saying, “The name of the man with whom I worked today is Boaz.”

content: 20 Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, “Blessed be he of the LORD, who has not failed in His kindness to the living or to the dead! For,” Naomi explained to her daughter-in-law, “the man is related to us; he is one of our redeeming kinsmen.”
content_old: 20 Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, “Blessed be he of the LORD, who has not failed in His kindness to the living or to the dead! For,” Naomi explained to her daughter-in-law, “the man is related to us; he is one of our redeeming kinsmen.”

content: 21 Ruth the Moabite said, “He even told me, ‘Stay close by my workers until all my harvest is finished.’ ”
content_old: 21 Ruth the Moabite said, “He even told me, ‘Stay close by my workers until all my harvest is finished.’ ”

content: 22 And Naomi answered her daughter-in-law Ruth, “It is best, daughter, that you go out with his girls, and not be annoyed in some other field.”
content_old: 22 And Naomi answered her daughter-in-law Ruth, “It is best, daughter, that you go out with his girls, and not be annoyed in some other field.”

content: 1 Naomi, her mother-in-law, said to her, “Daughter, I must seek a home for you, where you may be happy.
content_old: 1 Naomi, her mother-in-law, said to her, “Daughter, I must seek a home for you, where you may be happy.

content: 2 Now there is our kinsman Boaz, whose girls you were close to. He will be winnowing barley on the threshing floor tonight.
content_old: 2 Now there is our kinsman Boaz, whose girls you were close to. He will be winnowing barley on the threshing floor tonight.

content: 3 So bathe, anoint yourself, dress up, and go down to the threshing floor. But do not disclose yourself to the man until he has finished eating and drinking.
content_old: 3 So bathe, anoint yourself, dress up, and go down to the threshing floor. But do not disclose yourself to the man until he has finished eating and drinking.

content: 4 When he lies down, note the place where he lies down, and go over and uncover his feet and lie down. He will tell you what you are to do.”
content_old: 4 When he lies down, note the place where he lies down, and go over and uncover his feet and lie down. He will tell you what you are to do.”

content: 5 She replied, “I will do everything you tell me.”
content_old: 5 She replied, “I will do everything you tell me.”

content: 6 She went down to the threshing floor and did just as her mother-in-law had instructed her.
content_old: 6 She went down to the threshing floor and did just as her mother-in-law had instructed her.

content: 7 Boaz ate and drank, and in a cheerful mood went to lie down beside the grainpile. Then she went over stealthily and uncovered his feet and lay down.
content_old: 7 Boaz ate and drank, and in a cheerful mood went to lie down beside the grainpile. Then she went over stealthily and uncovered his feet and lay down.

content: 8 In the middle of the night, the man gave a start and pulled back—there was a woman lying at his feet!
content_old: 8 In the middle of the night, the man gave a start and pulled back—there was a woman lying at his feet!

content: 9 “Who are you?” he asked. And she replied, “I am your handmaid Ruth. Spread your robe over your handmaid, for you are a redeeming kinsman.”
content_old: 9 “Who are you?” he asked. And she replied, “I am your handmaid Ruth. Spread your robe over your handmaid, for you are a redeeming kinsman.”

content: 10 He exclaimed, “Be blessed of the LORD, daughter! Your latest deed of loyalty is greater than the first, in that you have not turned to younger men, whether poor or rich.
content_old: 10 He exclaimed, “Be blessed of the LORD, daughter! Your latest deed of loyalty is greater than the first, in that you have not turned to younger men, whether poor or rich.

content: 11 And now, daughter, have no fear. I will do in your behalf whatever you ask, for all the elders of my town know what a fine woman you are.
content_old: 11 And now, daughter, have no fear. I will do in your behalf whatever you ask, for all the elders of my town know what a fine woman you are.

content: 12 But while it is true I am a redeeming kinsman, there is another redeemer closer than I.
content_old: 12 But while it is true I am a redeeming kinsman, there is another redeemer closer than I.

content: 13 Stay for the night. Then in the morning, if he will act as a redeemer, good! let him redeem. But if he does not want to act as redeemer for you, I will do so myself, as the LORD lives! Lie down until morning.”
content_old: 13 Stay for the night. Then in the morning, if he will act as a redeemer, good! let him redeem. But if he does not want to act as redeemer for you, I will do so myself, as the LORD lives! Lie down until morning.”

content: 14 So she lay at his feet until dawn. She rose before one person could distinguish another, for he thought, “Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor.”
content_old: 14 So she lay at his feet until dawn. She rose before one person could distinguish another, for he thought, “Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor.”

content: 15 And he said, “Hold out the shawl you are wearing.” She held it while he measured out six measures of barley, and he put it on her back. When she got back to the town,
content_old: 15 And he said, “Hold out the shawl you are wearing.” She held it while he measured out six measures of barley, and he put it on her back. When she got back to the town,

content: 16 she came to her mother-in-law, who asked, “How is it with you, daughter?” She told her all that the man had done for her;
content_old: 16 she came to her mother-in-law, who asked, “How is it with you, daughter?” She told her all that the man had done for her;

content: 17 and she added, “He gave me these six measures of barley, saying to me, ‘Do not go back to your mother-in-law empty-handed.’ ”
content_old: 17 and she added, “He gave me these six measures of barley, saying to me, ‘Do not go back to your mother-in-law empty-handed.’ ”

content: 1 Meanwhile, Boaz had gone to the gate and sat down there. And now the redeemer whom Boaz had mentioned passed by. He called, “Come over and sit down here, So-and-so!” And he came over and sat down.
content_old: 1 Meanwhile, Boaz had gone to the gate and sat down there. And now the redeemer whom Boaz had mentioned passed by. He called, “Come over and sit down here, So-and-so!” And he came over and sat down.

content: 2 Then Boaz took ten elders of the town and said, “Be seated here”; and they sat down.
content_old: 2 Then Boaz took ten elders of the town and said, “Be seated here”; and they sat down.

content: 3 He said to the redeemer, “Naomi, now returned from the country of Moab, must sell the piece of land which belonged to our kinsman Elimelech.
content_old: 3 He said to the redeemer, “Naomi, now returned from the country of Moab, must sell the piece of land which belonged to our kinsman Elimelech.

content: 4 I thought I should disclose the matter to you and say: Acquire it in the presence of those seated here and in the presence of the elders of my people. If you are willing to redeem it, redeem! But if you will not redeem, tell me, that I may know. For there is no one to redeem but you, and I come after you.” “I am willing to redeem it,” he replied.
content_old: 4 I thought I should disclose the matter to you and say: Acquire it in the presence of those seated here and in the presence of the elders of my people. If you are willing to redeem it, redeem! But if you will not redeem, tell me, that I may know. For there is no one to redeem but you, and I come after you.” “I am willing to redeem it,” he replied.

content: 5 Boaz continued, “When you acquire the property from Naomi and from Ruth the Moabite, you must also acquire the wife of the deceased, so as to perpetuate the name of the deceased upon his estate.”
content_old: 5 Boaz continued, “When you acquire the property from Naomi and from Ruth the Moabite, you must also acquire the wife of the deceased, so as to perpetuate the name of the deceased upon his estate.”

content: 6 The redeemer replied, “Then I cannot redeem it for myself, lest I impair my own estate. You take over my right of redemption, for I am unable to exercise it.”
content_old: 6 The redeemer replied, “Then I cannot redeem it for myself, lest I impair my own estate. You take over my right of redemption, for I am unable to exercise it.”

content: 7 Now this was formerly done in Israel in cases of redemption or exchange: to validate any transaction, one man would take off his sandal and hand it to the other. Such was the practice in Israel.
content_old: 7 Now this was formerly done in Israel in cases of redemption or exchange: to validate any transaction, one man would take off his sandal and hand it to the other. Such was the practice in Israel.

content: 8 So when the redeemer said to Boaz, “Acquire for yourself,” he drew off his sandal.
content_old: 8 So when the redeemer said to Boaz, “Acquire for yourself,” he drew off his sandal.

content: 9 And Boaz said to the elders and to the rest of the people, “You are witnesses today that I am acquiring from Naomi all that belonged to Elimelech and all that belonged to Chilion and Mahlon.
content_old: 9 And Boaz said to the elders and to the rest of the people, “You are witnesses today that I am acquiring from Naomi all that belonged to Elimelech and all that belonged to Chilion and Mahlon.

content: 10 I am also acquiring Ruth the Moabite, the wife of Mahlon, as my wife, so as to perpetuate the name of the deceased upon his estate, that the name of the deceased may not disappear from among his kinsmen and from the gate of his home town. You are witnesses today.”
content_old: 10 I am also acquiring Ruth the Moabite, the wife of Mahlon, as my wife, so as to perpetuate the name of the deceased upon his estate, that the name of the deceased may not disappear from among his kinsmen and from the gate of his home town. You are witnesses today.”

content: 11 All the people at the gate and the elders answered, “We are. May the LORD make the woman who is coming into your house like Rachel and Leah, both of whom built up the House of Israel! Prosper in Ephrathah and perpetuate your name in Bethlehem!
content_old: 11 All the people at the gate and the elders answered, “We are. May the LORD make the woman who is coming into your house like Rachel and Leah, both of whom built up the House of Israel! Prosper in Ephrathah and perpetuate your name in Bethlehem!

content: 12 And may your house be like the house of Perez whom Tamar bore to Judah—through the offspring which the LORD will give you by this young woman.”
content_old: 12 And may your house be like the house of Perez whom Tamar bore to Judah—through the offspring which the LORD will give you by this young woman.”

content: 13 So Boaz married Ruth; she became his wife, and he cohabited with her. The LORD let her conceive, and she bore a son.
content_old: 13 So Boaz married Ruth; she became his wife, and he cohabited with her. The LORD let her conceive, and she bore a son.

content: 14 And the women said to Naomi, “Blessed be the LORD, who has not withheld a redeemer from you today! May his name be perpetuated in Israel!
content_old: 14 And the women said to Naomi, “Blessed be the LORD, who has not withheld a redeemer from you today! May his name be perpetuated in Israel!

content: 15 He will renew your life and sustain your old age; for he is born of your daughter-in-law, who loves you and is better to you than seven sons.”
content_old: 15 He will renew your life and sustain your old age; for he is born of your daughter-in-law, who loves you and is better to you than seven sons.”

content: 16 Naomi took the child and held it to her bosom. She became its foster mother,
content_old: 16 Naomi took the child and held it to her bosom. She became its foster mother,

content: 17 and the women neighbors gave him a name, saying, “A son is born to Naomi!” They named him Obed; he was the father of Jesse, father of David.
content_old: 17 and the women neighbors gave him a name, saying, “A son is born to Naomi!” They named him Obed; he was the father of Jesse, father of David.

content: 18 This is the line of Perez: Perez begot Hezron,
content_old: 18 This is the line of Perez: Perez begot Hezron,

content: 19 Hezron begot Ram, Ram begot Amminadab,
content_old: 19 Hezron begot Ram, Ram begot Amminadab,

content: 20 Amminadab begot Nahshon, Nahshon begot Salmon,
content_old: 20 Amminadab begot Nahshon, Nahshon begot Salmon,

content: 21 Salmon begot Boaz, Boaz begot Obed,
